item.title: Day 19: Do It Again...
item.description:
"I've seen You move, come move the mountains
And I believe, I'll see You do it again
You made a way, where there was no way
And I believe, I'll see You do it again"
-Elevation Worship

Being confident of this, that he who began a good work
item.dc:creator: E
item.content:encoded:
"I've seen You move, come move the mountains
And I believe, I'll see You do it again
You made a way, where there was no way
And I believe, I'll see You do it again"
-Elevation Worship

Being confident of this, that he who began a good work in you will carry it on to completion until the day of Christ Jesus. Philippians 1:6

A post shared by Steven Furtick (@stevenfurtick) on Mar 13, 2018 at 1:06pm PDT

Stumbled upon this amazing post by my man Steven Furtick...
The üë®‚Äçüíª in me really resonates with the analogy:

"The cross is my operating system"

Everything I do goes through my operating system...

  • Every thought or idea
  • Every breath
  • Every decision
  • Every dream

It's been nearly a month since I exercised or broke a sweat... And losing the ability to move like I used to / like I want to has been the most mentally straining part of this rehab.
Neuroscientifically speaking, there are so many benefits to incorporating exercise into one's life:

  • Stress / anxiety relief, endorphin-release
  • Enhanced brain plasticity
  • Enhanced learning and memory
  • New neurons, and longer lived neurons
  • Improved mood and sleep

If you don't believe me check out these sources:
Harvard, BrainHQ, Huffington Post, University of California, MyFitnessPal
And so this lack of exercise has really got me feeling some type of way (basically a lack of all those benefits above^)

Anyways, today my therapist asked me to hold plank "as long as you can".
AND I THOUGHT - "CHALLENGE ACCEPTED!" while hesitant if I could even go for a minute... üí•
4:00 Plank... BIG WIN. FIRST TAKE. ONE-N-DONE. Here I thought I was weak and here God was like "boy, please... watch me work"
(Also, I lowkey think that the plank is less a measure of one's physical strength and more of one's mental toughness... but maybe that's just meü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è)
Finally broke a sweat today üòÖ‚ò∫Ô∏è

üí™

  • PT Day 1
  • CPM still at 90¬™
  • Increasing usage of leg: adding new exercises
  • Single leg balance, plank, pushups, hammie curls, gastroc raises

üôå

  • I'm still alive and kicking
  • Very grateful for the educational opportunities I have received throughout my life... I took school for granted because... well HW. Now I see how much of a blessing it is
  • Family friends are calling me up to help with tech, babysitting, and tutoring. It's nice to be utilized in this time of physical pain and mental turmoil.
  • I can finally shower without saran wrap

üôè

  • Serve the high schoolers #FTK
  • Increased productivity
  • Patience with fam and students I tutor
  • More prayer throughout my days

If you need a little sumpin' sumpin' to lift your spirits, please take a listen:

item.title: Day 14: Physical Therapy
item.description:
The light is beginning to shine at the end of the tunnel...
It's not much; just a glimmer, but it's present

Updates:

  • Unsure if I should post daily... progress on my knee is SOOO SLOW THESE DAYS...
  • My mind wants to do more than my body can do
  • I can't
item.dc:creator: E
item.content:encoded:
The light is beginning to shine at the end of the tunnel...
It's not much; just a glimmer, but it's present

Updates:

  • Unsure if I should post daily... progress on my knee is SOOO SLOW THESE DAYS...
  • My mind wants to do more than my body can do
  • I can't let physical weakness translate to mental weakness. I can still think clearly, focus, and problem solve... so what's holding me back?
  • I need to learn to use this "waiting time" to the fullest.
  • ü§îWhat's something I can't do that I would do if I were healthy?
  • ü§îNow what's something I probably wouldn't have time to do if I were healthy?

‚ÄúIf you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you'll never get it done.‚Äù
-Bruce Lee

Physical Therapy:

  • PT Evaluation today; my protocol is above
  • Nothing new... assess pain levels, goals of PT, etc.
  • Wait; wait; and more waiting... This rehab doesn't really start until the stitching is strong (Weeks 4-6)
  • Fully locked brace until week 6ish
  • My quad strength is definitely coming back faster than ACL.
  • Don't go past 90¬∫ with CPM

üôå

  • Parents who always refill my gameready ice machine with fresh ice ‚ùÑÔ∏è
  • Home-cooked meals
  • Sleeping better

üôè

  • I am a good role model for the high school boys (sophomores) in the small group I co-lead.
  • Better sleep. "DORMIR ES PODER"
  • Love my parents better, especially while I am at home

item.title: Day 13: Move Stitch(es)... Get Out the Way
item.description:
Before

After

It's a blessing how seamless modern medicine can be.
(see what I did there üòÖ)
I read this killer article by Kevin Love today:
https://www.theplayerstribune.com/kevin-love-everyone-is-going-through-something/

It discussed how everyone is going through their own battles and it's more than OK to seek help
For men,
item.dc:creator: E
item.content:encoded:
Before

After

It's a blessing how seamless modern medicine can be.
(see what I did there üòÖ)
I read this killer article by Kevin Love today:
https://www.theplayerstribune.com/kevin-love-everyone-is-going-through-something/

It discussed how everyone is going through their own battles and it's more than OK to seek help
For men, we've been conditioned by America's lies that if you can't do, get through, or deal with something on your own, then you're weak and not a "man"... But once again. This is absolute BS.

I'll get into more of my thoughts on masculinity in another post.

Updates:

  • Still have trouble sleeping

üôå

  • The healthcare system (thankful for how fast and high quality my treatment was)
  • Music - the sounds of my soul, and sometimes my only friend as I lay in bed

üôè

  • First day of PT starts tomorrow
  • Focus on what I can do in this season of "waiting"
  • Positive attitude

P.S. storm trooper image just for kicks

item.title: Day 11: Mine
item.description:
07:30 Day started off with an early wake-up call, knee was aching because I left the gameready sleeve on it and it was propped up at an angle.
I put the brace on and slept until 11:30

Been trying to play this song üé∏ like Justin Bieber

Almost looking
item.dc:creator: E
item.content:encoded:
07:30 Day started off with an early wake-up call, knee was aching because I left the gameready sleeve on it and it was propped up at an angle.
I put the brace on and slept until 11:30

Been trying to play this song üé∏ like Justin Bieber

Almost looking like my good side:


The injured leg is finally starting to feel like it's mine again. I am finally regaining ownership of that leg again.
It is finally moving, behaving like I want it to.

But honestly, are these bodies really ours to claim???
Or are they merely blessings, gifts, vessels that have been given to us...

Updates:

  • Walking with brace is üç∞
  • CPM cranked up to 90¬∫ because I can
  • Continually improving quad strength

üôå

  • This time in life to rest and recover and really relax
  • Thankful for healthy eyes, hearing, breathing, smelling, and sense of touch
  • The way God puts people in your life just at the right time

üôè

  • Better sleep, my body is waking up way too early because of achy knee
  • Love my parents better, especially while I am at home
  • Allergy doctors respond to my cries of help

item.title: Manos a la Obra (de Cristo)
item.description: 1. Aceptar el reto de salir y hablar del amor del Cristo require amor, esfuerzo, y compromiso. 2. Salir al mundo es bueno pero solo si estas entrenado para ser Sal y Luz el la oscuridad 3. El Esp√≠ritu Santo de Dios y la Palabra de Dios son nuestra protecci√≥n Divina.
item.dc:creator: E
item.content:encoded:
La Vi√±a 3/4/18

La frase "manos a la obra" es remangarnos las mangas Y ponernos a trabajar de principio a fin por una determinada o causa.
Al expresar esta frase demostramos no s√≥lo compromiso, sino, entrega de nosotros mismos, no dejaremos el proyecto incompleto; ni a la gente trabajando sola.
Si una persona que cumple con sus compromisos es considerada valiosa. Cuanto a√∫n m√°s los hijos de Dios.

Nuestro caso como cristianos, ¬øen donde vamos a poner manos a la obra?
Obviamente en los asuntos de Jes√∫s, es decir, en ‚Äúla obra de Dios‚Äù, pero no podemos hacerla solo dentro de la iglesia, aqu√≠ ya todos somos salvos.
‚ÄúSabemos que somos de Dios, y el mundo entero est√° bajo el maligno.‚Äù (1 Juan 5:19)
Cristo quiere que nuestro cristianismo los reflejemos fuera de estas cuatro paredes; en el mundo, en lo secular, Adonde no hay esperanza, a donde no hay amor, adonde el ego√≠smo, La vanidad y la perversi√≥n abundan, porque ahora este es el dominio de Satan√°s.
Para esto es importante, no s√≥lo saber y conocer de Dios, sino, tambi√©n hacerla.
Saber es s√≥lo una funci√≥n mental respecto a nuestra salvaci√≥n, conocer se obtiene por el meditar en la palabra de Dios; pero el hacer, implica esa Palabra; Y requiere voluntad, compromiso y entrega en el diario caminar el Se√±or cumpliendo sus mandatos.
Debemos poner manos a la obra en el servicio a Cristo, ‚ÄúLa mies es mucha y los trabajadores son pocos‚Äù (Mateo 9:37), pero somos pocos, porque le huimos el compromiso, sentimos que no estamos listos para trabajar para Dios. Nos detenemos a meditar en d√≥nde enfocar nuestras prioridades y dejamos al final lo m√°s importante. Y mientras tanto ‚ÄúLas almas perdidas van como ovejas al matadero‚Äù (Romanos 8:36)
Tenemos todo para servir a aquel que nos salv√≥ de ir al matadero; Tenemos una vida, una Biblia, y el Esp√≠ritu Santo de Dios dentro; para que act√∫e y hable por nosotros a donde quiera que vayamos.
¬°As√≠ que manos a la obra!

Puntos del Mensaje

  1. Aceptar el reto de salir y hablar del amor del Cristo require amor, esfuerzo, y compromiso.
  2. Salir al mundo es bueno pero solo si estas entrenado para ser Sal y Luz el la oscuridad
  3. El Esp√≠ritu Santo de Dios y la Palabra de Dios son nuestra protecci√≥n Divina.

An√°lisis del Servicio

En primer lugar, la adoraci√≥n fue incre√≠ble. Me encanta cantar en espa√±ol. No se por qu√©, pero me siento algo poderoso.
La √∫nica cancion que reconoc√≠ era "Reinas por Eternidad" de Hillsong (Forever Reign)

La letra es tan hermosa

Bueno es Dios, Bueno es Dios
Cuando nada hay bueno en m√≠
Tu amor, Tu amor
No se puede resistir
Eres luz, Eres luz
Aun en la oscuridad
Eres fiel, Eres fiel
Has borrado mi maldad

Eres paz, Eres paz
Aun en medio del temor
La verdad, La verdad
Cuando ando en confusi√≥n
La raz√≥n, La raz√≥n
De mi gozo est√° en Jes√∫s
El venci√≥, El venci√≥
A la muerte en la cruz

T√∫ me abrazas con tu amor
Me abrazas con tu amor
Tu gracia me encontr√≥
Cambi√≥ mi coraz√≥n
Nada se puede comparar
Reinas por la eternidad

Eres m√°s, Eres m√°s
De lo que puedo expresar
Eres Rey, Eres Rey
La creaci√≥n proclamar√°
Aqu√≠ est√°s, Aqu√≠ est√°s
Tu presencia es real
Eres Dios, Eres Dios
Lo pasado dejo atr√°s

Mi coraz√≥n
Te cantar√°
Jes√∫s
Jes√∫s

Por lo general, el servicio fue un poco aburrido.
No hab√≠a chistes o bromas durante el serm√≥n. (no es una necesidad, pero sent√≠a como si hubiera asistado a una clase... con una diapositiva de PowerPoint tambi√©n)

En mi opini√≥n, ella habl√≥ tantas palabras sobre poco contenido. El serm√≥n me dio nada nuevo.

Los puntos del mensaje eran b√°sicos y ella no nos proporcion√≥ con una aplicaci√≥n del mundo real.
... pues no nos quedamos por la duraci√≥n del servicio.
Es posible que haya m√°s informaci√≥n y una aplicaci√≥n del mundo real pero nunca lo sabremos...

item.description:

üí•

Whoa... worlds colliding

Updates:

  • Stitches are
item.dc:creator: E
item.content:encoded:
We out here... shopping on my own

Chelle and I went to visit one of the Guatemala mission trip high school students at Chipotle (where they work) and turns out they are 'BEST FRIENDS' with 2 boys I used to lead in middle school.

üí•

Whoa... worlds colliding

Updates:

  • Stitches are a little itchy
  • No problems walking, just slow
  • CPM up to 75¬∫ since day 5 has been so boring
  • Need to figure out when I can increase this ROM
  • Continually improving quad strength

üôå

  • Seeing how God connects everything back to Him
  • Smoothies... need I say more
  • A relatively stable mental state
  • The capacity to remember the most obscure details and facts about people and things

üôè

  • The brodie, just that he's doing alright, working hard in school, and staying healthy
  • Paige as she is in New Zealand for a wedding, safe and healthy travels, more peace
  • My friend as they hope to transfer to a good basketball program (hopefully NU, let's go Wildcats)
  • The green light to work out soon

item.title: Day 6: Alive
item.description:
Let's start off with some spoken word üî•... One of my favorites

Today I milked my injury for every last drop it's worth...
You can bet I cut the whole DMV line üòÇ

‚ôøÔ∏è -> üöóüèÜ

Ignite bible study üî•üëìüëª

  • First follow up visit went well, better understood my limitations and the healing
item.dc:creator: E
item.content:encoded:
Let's start off with some spoken word üî•... One of my favorites

Today I milked my injury for every last drop it's worth...
You can bet I cut the whole DMV line üòÇ

‚ôøÔ∏è -> üöóüèÜ

Ignite bible study üî•üëìüëª

Updates:

  • First follow up visit went well, better understood my limitations and the healing process
  • Full mobility without crutches, keep knee at full extension
  • Quad strengthening has been going well, SLRs without brace
  • Leg aches and is sore at night after weightbearing

üôå

  • Successful surgery follow-up appointment
  • Convincing the little sister to go to Ignite üî•
  • Handicap parking permit is more clutch than a stick-shift
  • This Gameready ‚ùÑÔ∏èmachine was and is a GAMECHANGER for my recovery
  • Less than a week and I'm crutches-free

üôè

  • Guatemala mission trip students and the host-families
  • Continued physical and bodily healing for family
  • A solution to food intolerances in me and my family
  • High schoolers who want to know the Lord
  • Everyone affected by the Parkland shooting

For those who want the spoken word transcript:

The following are true stories.
May 26th 2003 Aron Ralston was hiking, a boulder fell on his right hand. He waited four days, then amputated his arm with a pocket knife.
On New Year‚Äôs Eve, a woman was bungee jumping in Zimbabwe. The cord broke, she then fell into a river and had to swim back to land in crocodile infested waters with a broken collarbone.
Claire Champlin was smashed in the face by a five pound watermelon being propelled by a slingshot.
Matthew Brobst was hit by a javelin.
David Striegl was punched in the mouth. By a kangaroo.
The most amazing part about these stories is when asked about the experience they all smiled, shrugged, and said ‚ÄúI guess things could have been worse.‚Äù
So go ahead.
Tell me that you‚Äôre having a bad day.
Tell me about the traffic. Tell me about your boss. Tell me about the job you‚Äôve been trying to quit for the past four years. Tell me the morning is just a town house burning to the ground and the snooze button is a fire extinguisher. Tell me the alarm clock stole the keys to your smile, drove it into 7:00 AM, and the crash totaled your happiness.
Tell me! Tell me!
Tell me, how blessed are we to have tragedies so small it can fit on the tips of our tongues?
You see, when Evan lost his legs he was speechless. When my cousin was assaulted, she didn‚Äôt speak for forty eight hours. When my uncle was murdered, we had to send out a search party to find my father‚Äôs voice.
Most people have no idea that tragedy and silence have the exact same address.
When your day is a museum of disappointments hanging from events that were outside of your control, when you find yourself flailing in an ocean of ‚ÄúWhy is this happening to me?‚Äù, when it feels like your guardian angel put in his two week notice two months ago and just decided not to tell you, when it feels like God is just a babysitter that‚Äôs always on the phone, when you get punched in the esophagus by a fistful of life, remember that every year two million people die of dehydration so it doesn‚Äôt matter if the glass is half full or half empty, there‚Äôs water in the cup.
Drink it, and stop complaining.
Muscle is created by repeatedly lifting things that have been designed to weigh us down. So when your shoulders feel heavy, stand up straight and lift your chin ‚Äì call it exercise. When the world crumbles around you, you have to look at the wreckage and then build a new one out of the pieces that are still here.
Remember, you are still here.
The human heart beats approximately four thousand times per hour.
Each pulse, each throb, each palpitation is a trophy engraved with the words ‚ÄúYou are still alive‚Äù.
You are still alive.
Act like it.

item.title: Day 5: The Rockiest Road
item.description:
Challenges are what make life interesting and overcoming them is what makes life meaningful.
-Joshua Marine

I think that it may be rewarding to overcome challenges, but I don't think that's all there is to making life meaningful.

God's Plan didn't promise a life without challenges and facing and overcoming
item.dc:creator: E
item.content:encoded:
Challenges are what make life interesting and overcoming them is what makes life meaningful.
-Joshua Marine

I think that it may be rewarding to overcome challenges, but I don't think that's all there is to making life meaningful.

God's Plan didn't promise a life without challenges and facing and overcoming challenges is something I think that makes us human. Every single human in the history of time has faced a challenge. It's something we all have in common. No doubt.

I personally think resilience is within every one of us. We just have to choose whether or not we want to persist and persevere.

Yes... this is ANOTHER KNEE SURGERY; but who am I to back down now???
At this point, if I've learned anything it's that I need to stop wasting time complaining, whining, and feeling sorry / sad / confused / lonely in the worst way about the injury.
It's out of my control and if watching THIS IS US üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ has taught me anything, it's that

Life will give you lemons. But there's no lemon so sour that you can't make something resembling lemonade.
-THIS IS US

I was thoroughly delighted to have the lil sis entertain me today with vegan ice cream üç¶üòã
Even though she's the type of person who never responds to texts WHEN SHE HAS HER IPHONE ATTACHED TO HER WRIST WITH ONE OF THEM NEWFANGLED APPLE WATCHES ü§Øüò©üò§üòë
The only thing closer would be a phone connected to your brain...
(Yeah, I'm going to rant about that because this is my blog. So if you're reading this Auds, answer your texts)

and a throwback Taylor Swift jam sesh üé∂

This is what you get for uncovering my webcam üòÇ
(If you can guess this song, I'll give you a prize üèÜ)

Updates:

  • Slept better than Day 4, (thank you benadryl)
  • Increased mobility and ambulation
  • Can weightbear completely on surgical leg and balance (full extension ONLY)
  • Pain when standing / walking for some time
  • Walked (slowly) for 10 minutes today

üôå

  • Ice cream... VEGAN ICE CREAM
  • Music and the ability to jam even when I'm crippled
  • Homemade blueberry muffins
  • Guatemala Phase 1 meeting was a success

üôè

  • Continued prayer for the Guatemala high school team
  • Rachel and IJM in Bolivia
  • Aud's health
  • First follow-up knee appointment tomorrow

item.title: Day 4: Time
item.description:
Forgot to pop a benadryl üíä last night to help me fall asleep

Slept from about 01:00 - 06:30, waking up due to the aching pain
...I also forgot to wear brace to sleep

Attempted to go back to bed until around 10:30

Finished prescribed dosage of antibiotics
item.dc:creator: E
item.content:encoded:
Forgot to pop a benadryl üíä last night to help me fall asleep

Slept from about 01:00 - 06:30, waking up due to the aching pain
...I also forgot to wear brace to sleep

Attempted to go back to bed until around 10:30

Finished prescribed dosage of antibiotics -> Healthy üí© today!

Updates:

  • Ankle pumps are going well
  • CPM is painless
  • Achy and stiff sometimes
  • Still sensitive to touch move at times
  • Can weightbear without crutch now walking very very slowly

üôå

  • Thank God for time. Time to relax, sleep in, read books, watch movies, and do literally whatever I want
  • Body and mind aren't too fatigued from pain
  • Parents for cooking for me

üôè

  • Upcoming Guatemala high school mission trip
  • Healing for me, and my fam who are injured as well
  • Pray for fam dealing with sickness / health issues
  • Willie as he is abroad in Italy
  • Sophomore boys grow closer and trust each other
  • An end to the mask of masculinity that America wears

item.title: What is Poverty?
item.description:
Instead of asking first world Americans what poverty is... let's ask those who truly experience it. (Here are some responses, country name in CAPS)

"For a poor person everything is terrible‚Äîillness, humiliation, shame. We are cripples; we are afraid of everything; we depend on everyone. No one needs
item.dc:creator: E
item.content:encoded:
Instead of asking first world Americans what poverty is... let's ask those who truly experience it. (Here are some responses, country name in CAPS)

"For a poor person everything is terrible‚Äîillness, humiliation, shame. We are cripples; we are afraid of everything; we depend on everyone. No one needs us. We are like garbage that everyone wants to get rid of."
‚Äî MOLDOVA

"During the past two years we have not celebrated any holidays with others. We cannot afford to invite anyone to our house and we feel uncomfortable visiting others without bringing a present. The lack of contact leaves one depressed, creates a constant feeling of unhappiness, and a sense of low self-esteem."
‚Äî LATVIA

"When one is poor, she has no say in public, she feels inferior. She has no food, so there is famine in her house; no clothing, and no progress in her family."
‚Äî UGANDA

"[The poor have] a feeling of powerlessness and an inability to make themselves heard."
‚Äî CAMEROON

"Your hunger is never satisfied, your thirst is never quenched; you can never sleep until you are no longer tired."
‚Äî SENEGAL

"What determines poverty or well-being? The indigenous people's destiny is to be poor."
‚Äî ECUADOR

The poor define poverty as more than lack of material possessions.
It is conditions more psychological and social then what we think: shame, inferiority, powerlessness, humiliation, fear, hopelessness, depression, social isolation, voicelessness, personal worthlessness, and social despair

We in the US tend to emphasize poverty as a lack of material things.
Analogy: Going to the doctor to treat an illness

  1. Doctor can misdiagnose the illness
  2. Doctor can merely try to reduce the symptoms (Mucinex)

If poverty is... -> Solution

Lack of knowledge -> education
Oppression by the powerful -> social justice
The personal sins of the poor -> evangelism and discipleship of the poor
Lack of material resources -> give $$$

Most of the time, simply giving money will do more harm than good because it doesn't get to the root cause of poverty.

Poverty alleviation efforts should be multifaceted as well
Human beings are spiritual, social, psychological, and physical beings

Our basic predisposition toward poor communities (people, organizations, institutions, culture) should include the notion that they are part of the good world that Christ created and is sustaining.

We are NOT bringing Christ to poor communities for the very first time. He has been active in these communities since the creation of the world.
A significant part of working in these poorer communities involves discovering and appreciating what God has been doing there for a long time.

The effects of the fall are manifested in the economic, social, religious, and political systems that humans have created throughout history

"Poverty is the result of relationships that do not work, that are not just, that are not for life, that are not harmonious or enjoyable. Poverty is the absence of shalom in all its meanings"
-Myers

There is still inherent goodness as Christ "holds all things together" and to "sustain all things by his powerful word"

WHO ARE THE POOR?

Every human being is poor in the sense of not experiencing these four relationships in the way that God intended.
We are all suffering from a poverty of spiritual intimacy, community, and stewardship

Until we recognize and embrace our mutual brokenness, our work with low-income people is likely to do more harm than good.

A shame called "poverty of being" is a major part of the brokenness that low-income people experience in their relationship with themselves. They feel inferior to others. This paralyzes the poor from taking initiative and seizing opportunities to improve their situation. They don't see them as children of God, highly valued, and sought after by the King Himself.

The 1st World "God-Complex"

The economically rich, higher-income population also suffers from the poverty of being.
"God-complex": subtle and unconscious sense of superiority in which they believe that they have achieved their wealth through their own efforts and that they have been anointed to decide what is best for low-income people, whom they view as inferior to themselves

How do you know you have a ‚Äúgod-complex‚Äù?
Why do you really want to help the poor?
Does it feel good to help those with less? It‚Äôs common to unintentionally reduce poor people to objects to fulfill a need to accomplish something ‚Äúgood‚Äù or ‚Äúnoble‚Äù.

One of the biggest problems in many poverty-alleviation efforts is that their design and implementation exacerbates the poverty of being of the economically rich (their god-complexes) and the poverty of being of the economically poor (their feelings of inferiority and shame)

The way we act towards the economically poor often communicates that we are superior and they are inferior.
When this problem is ignored, the shame and inferiority in the economically poor increase AND "compassion fatigue" (decreased willingness to help, increased disdain for those that are being helped) begins to develop in those trying to help.

Equation
Material definition of poverty + God-complexes of materially non-poor + Feelings of inferiority of materially poor = Harm to both materially poor and non-poor

By showing low-income people through our words, actions, and most importantly our ears that they are people with unique gifts and abilities, we can be part of helping them to recover their sense of dignity, even as we recover from our sense of pride.

Health and Wealth Gospel

We in America have sufficient buffers in place to shield us from most economic shocks.
We don't really need to trust God's sovereignty just to get us through the day.
Health and wealth gospel teaches that God rewards increasing levels of faith with greater amounts of wealth.
This is COMPLETE BS

WE ARE ALL POOR AND BROKEN

That being said, the economically poor face a unique set of struggles:
Vulnerability, powerlessness, isolation, physical weakness, helplessness, anxiety, suffocation, desperation unparalleled in the lives of the rest of humanity.
Lack of freedom to be able to make meaningful choices to affect one's situation

I chose this stock photo (at the top of this post) not because it has a sad-looking baby, but because the most advanced objects in the photo are the jacket zipper and the clean cut 2x4 pieces of wood.

item.title: Day 3: Death Valley
item.description:
Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death,
I will fear no evil,
for you are with me;
your rod and your staff,
they comfort me.
-Psalm 23

Pain level still at üî•üî•
Foot looks discolored compared to non-surgical side... hmm ü§î

~08:30 Woke up to an
item.dc:creator: E
item.content:encoded:
Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death,
I will fear no evil,
for you are with me;
your rod and your staff,
they comfort me.
-Psalm 23

Pain level still at üî•üî•
Foot looks discolored compared to non-surgical side... hmm ü§î

~08:30 Woke up to an aching knee.
Not horrible, but also not comfortable at all.

I saw the sun for the first time today in 3 days... haven't left the house since surgery.
What a time to be alive.

The highlight of my day was witnessing this MAGIC üé©
AKA DRY SHAMPOO (üôå shoutout to Vivi, you know who you are)

The "Death" in "Death Valley" better be referring to the death of the dandruff in my hair...

How to use dry shampoo (I didn't know until today)

  1. Point and spray directly on front and near roots (10 inches away from hair)
  2. Wait a minute
  3. Massage it in

Psalm 23 resonated with me and also with this dry shampoo üòÇ

God is with me through the hills and the valleys, in the victories and the suffering. I know this in my head, but I need to truly take it to heart.

üôå

  • Dry shampoo is a gift from God
  • ROM is solid
  • Weighbearing üö∂‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èwithout issues
  • Another laptop üíª donation
  • Drove üöó without issues

üôè

  • Increase ROM
  • More laptop donations
  • Physical therapy starts strong
  • Don't lose focus and persistence in planning Guatemala Mission
  • Face the pain, don't let it prevent me from LIVING MY BEST LIFE

item.title: Day 2: Uphill
item.description:
üî•üî•

Woke up to a fire in my knee around 09:00
Forgot to wear brace to bed last night, but knee feels alright
Knee pain level: üî•üî•

Feel the pain and do it anyway

It seems that humans are wired to avoid pain... we'll do anything to make it stop.
Which
item.dc:creator: E
item.content:encoded:
üî•üî•

Woke up to a fire in my knee around 09:00
Forgot to wear brace to bed last night, but knee feels alright
Knee pain level: üî•üî•

Feel the pain and do it anyway

It seems that humans are wired to avoid pain... we'll do anything to make it stop.
Which is why I have to be very intentional about doing things that cause pain.

Each leg movement sends ripples of pain through my leg.
Thankfully, it is tolerable.

Got in 4 sets of rehab in today.

No need for pain meds, hopefully it's downhill from here
The less I rely on drugs, the better in tune I am with my body and the recovery

üôå

  • Weightbearing with crutches is doable
  • Quad strength increasing
  • Sleeping well
  • Received first laptop donation for Phase 0

üôè

  • More laptop donations
  • Continued knee healing; Don't push the rehab... Let the healing happen
  • Love my parents more intentionally, especially since they are basically my caretakers this week

item.title: Day 1: One Step At A Time
item.description:
Hurry up and wait
So close, but so far away
Everything that you've always dreamed of
Close enough for you can taste
But you just can't touch
You wanna show the world, but no one knows your name yet
You wonder when and where and how you're gonna make it
item.dc:creator: E
item.content:encoded:
Hurry up and wait
So close, but so far away
Everything that you've always dreamed of
Close enough for you can taste
But you just can't touch
You wanna show the world, but no one knows your name yet
You wonder when and where and how you're gonna make it
You know you can if you get the chance
In your face as the door keeps slamming
Now you're feeling more and more frustrated
And you're getting all kind of impatient, waiting
We live and we learn to take
One step at a time
There's no need to rush
It's like learning to fly
Or falling in love
It's gonna happen and it's
Supposed to happen that we
Find the reasons why
One step at a time
-- Jordan Sparks

These lyrics are my anthem right now as I plan my mission to Guatemala.
I know it's going to happen. I can feel it.

09:41
The üî• in the knee is back... again..
So familiar yet so undesirable.
But it's like going on a roller coaster for the first time... scary, painful, but after you do it once; every time afterwards is less scary and less painful.

So yeah... with my experience, definitely less painful this time around.

Rehab sessions have been solid:

  • SLRs are good
  • Quad contractions are present
  • Weight bearing with locked brace is doable and pain hasn't been too much of an issue
  • Game Ready is üîë (Thank you bitcoin)

Patience, patience, patience
I feel like I don't do much in bed, but I know I am still very capable. Never underestimate the mind.

This is the time I need to work on improving my other skills:

  1. Spanish
  2. Guitar
  3. Reading
  4. Memory

item.title: Week 1 Training
item.description:
One Step At A Time

Objectives:

  • Full extension
  • Pain management
  • Quadriceps strengthening
  • Continuous Passive Motion (CPM)

Frequency:

  • 4-5 Times a Day
  • Exercises then CPM

Exercises:

  • SLR (1 x 10 raises)
  • Isometric quad contractions (10 x 10 second hold)
  • Ankle prop to work on developing full extension

CPM:

  1. Start at 10¬∫
item.dc:creator: E
item.content:encoded:
One Step At A Time

Objectives:

  • Full extension
  • Pain management
  • Quadriceps strengthening
  • Continuous Passive Motion (CPM)

Frequency:

  • 4-5 Times a Day
  • Exercises then CPM

Exercises:

  • SLR (1 x 10 raises)
  • Isometric quad contractions (10 x 10 second hold)
  • Ankle prop to work on developing full extension

CPM:

  1. Start at 10¬∫
  2. ++ 10¬∫ each day up to 70¬∫
  3. 60:00 sessions

Game Ready ‚ùÑÔ∏èüí™

  • 15 minutes after exercise
  • Medium -> high compression
  • Use when in pain
